snippet: The appearance of costumed versions of Tigger, Minnie Mouse and other characters from the United States, North Korea’s enemy, was remarkable fare on tightly controlled North Korean television.
abstract: North Korean state-run television shows footage of costumed versions of Disney characters prancing in front of the leader, Kim Jong-un, and an entourage of clapping generals; the appearance of the characters from the United States is remarkable fare on tightly controlled North Korean television, which usually shows more somber and overtly political programs; Kim’s rationale is a mystery, but there is a hint that the performance might be significant.

byline.contributor: Brooks Barnes contributed reporting from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: The appearance of costumed versions of Tigger, Minnie Mouse and other characters from the United States, North Korea’s enemy, was remarkable fare on tightly controlled North Korean television.

headline.seo: Kim Jong-un Appears With Disney Characters on North Korean TV
headline.main: On North Korean TV, a Dash of (Unapproved) Disney Magic
headline.print_headline: On North Korean TV, a Dash Of (Unapproved) Disney Magic
